newsitem.title: SOUTH AFRICA: Rareco says PM unit to be liquidated.
newsitem.headline: Rareco says PM unit to be liquidated.

text.p: Rareco Ltd said the sole executive director of Precision Magnets (PM), in which Rareco holds 50 percent, had successfully applied on Monday for the provisional liquidation of PM.

"We welcome this resolution of the uncertainty relating to Rareco's investment in Precision Magnets, which has totalled over eight million rand since our 1994 listing on the JSE," Rareco's managing director Mike Saner said in a statement.
He said Rareco's maximum exposure in the event of PM's liquidiation was expected to be less than one million rand which would be met from existing resources.

"Rareco's entire focus will now be on its rare earths core business, with a priority of raising capital for the development of the Steenkampskraal monazite mine and plant," Saner said, adding the company was confident about the future.
Rareco aimed to seize global market opportunities through its association with U.K.-based Meldform Metals, he added.
